description: Current Incident Response Policy and Procedures documentation, including version history, approval signatures, and evidence of annual review
Incident Response Plan with defined reportable incidents, metrics, resource requirements, information sharing protocols, and designated responsibilities
Incident response training records for privileged users and incident response personnel, including training completion dates, content, and attendance rosters
Evidence of incident response testing conducted within the past six months, including test plans, functional test results, and JAB/AO approval documentation
Incident handling procedures documentation covering preparation, detection, analysis, containment, eradication, and recovery phases
Incident tracking and monitoring records, including incident logs, status reports, and documentation of incidents from the past 12 months
Evidence of incident reporting to US-CERT and FedRAMP per NIST SP 800-61 timelines, including sample incident reports and communication records
Incident response support resource documentation, including help desk procedures, ticketing system access, and forensics service availability
List of incident response personnel and organizational elements with distribution records showing dissemination of the incident response plan to designated FedRAMP personnel
Information spillage response procedures, including assigned personnel roles, communication methods, isolation protocols, and eradication processes
Evidence of automated incident handling mechanisms, including system configurations for incident tracking, data collection, analysis tools, and dynamic reconfiguration capabilities
Incident response training materials covering simulated events, tabletop exercises, and information spillage scenarios with evidence of annual delivery
Documentation of lessons learned from incident handling activities and evidence of incorporation into incident response procedures, training, and testing
Insider threat incident handling procedures and capabilities documentation
Integrated incident response team charter, including team composition, deployment capabilities, time-to-deploy metrics, and cross-organizational coordination procedures
Evidence of coordination between incident response testing and related plans (business continuity, disaster recovery, contingency, crisis communications)
Supply chain incident reporting procedures and evidence of coordination with product/service providers per SR-8 requirements
Personnel security documentation demonstrating that incident handlers meet security requirements commensurate with system criticality/sensitivity
